skill.name: test-orchestrator
skill.description: Coordinates testing strategy and execution across all test types. Use when creating test plans, implementing tests (unit/integration/E2E), or enforcing coverage requirements (80% minimum). Applies testing-requirements.md.
skill.summary: Coordinates testing strategy and execution across all test types. Use when creating test plans, impl...
skill.author: Brownbull

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill defined entirely in SKILL.md. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own documentation. The skill defines testing coordination patterns and quality standards only.

content.value_statement: Testing quality and coverage vary across teams. Test Orchestrator provides systematic test planning, execution, and quality gates for consistent, reliable releases. Coordinates all testing activities with clear quality standards and automated enforcement.
actual_capabilities: Define test plans and test strategies for any component
Coordinate unit, integration, E2E, and performance testing
Enforce coverage thresholds (80% minimum for unit tests)
Block builds that fail quality gates
Generate quality metrics and coverage reports
Manage test data with fixtures, mocks, and factories
limitations: Does not execute tests directly - coordinates other test skills
Cannot modify production code or fix bugs automatically
Requires other skills for specific test implementations
Test execution depends on CI/CD pipeline availability

use_cases.title: Create comprehensive test plans
use_cases.description: Define test scenarios, coverage goals, and assign tests to appropriate skill types for any feature.

use_cases.title: Enforce quality gates
use_cases.description: Block merges when coverage drops below thresholds and receive actionable failure feedback.

use_cases.title: Automate testing workflows
use_cases.description: Integrate test execution into CI/CD pipelines with parallel runs and automated reporting.

prompt_templates.title: Plan new feature tests
prompt_templates.scenario: Start testing for a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a test plan for the [component name] feature. Include unit tests for all public methods (>80% coverage), integration tests for database operations and API calls, and E2E tests for the main user workflow. Set up test data fixtures and mocks for external services.

prompt_templates.title: Improve coverage
prompt_templates.scenario: Increase test coverage on existing code
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the current test coverage for [component]. Identify gaps in unit, integration, and E2E testing. Create a roadmap to reach 85% coverage with specific test scenarios for missing edge cases.

prompt_templates.title: Debug test failures
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the test results for [component]. Identify patterns in failures, determine if tests are flaky or indicate real issues, and recommend fixes. Provide a prioritized list of tests to repair.

prompt_templates.title: Set up CI testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a testing workflow for CI/CD integration. Define which tests run on each commit, which run nightly, and which require manual triggers. Specify quality gates that block deployment and generate coverage trends.

output_examples.input: Create a test plan for the user authentication component
output: - test_login_valid: Verify successful login with correct credentials
- test_login_nonexistent_user: Return appropriate error for unknown users
- test_session_token_generation: Ensure tokens are unique and time-limited
- test_password_hashing: Confirm passwords are never stored in plaintext
- test_database_user_lookup: Verify database queries return correct user data
- test_token_storage: Confirm session tokens are stored and retrieved correctly
- test_rate_limiting: Ensure login attempts are throttled after 5 failures
- user_login_workflow: Complete login flow from UI to authenticated state
- user_logout_flow: Verify session cleanup on logout
- password_reset_flow: End-to-end password recovery email and reset
Quality Gates: 80% coverage minimum, 0 flaky tests, all critical paths covered

best_practices: Follow the AAA pattern (Arrange, Act, Assert) for clear, readable tests
Keep tests isolated with no dependencies on execution order
Use meaningful test names that describe what is being verified
anti_patterns: Avoid tests that depend on execution order or shared state
Do not test implementation details that may change frequently
Never ignore flaky tests - they erode trust in the test suite

faq.question: Which testing frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Test Orchestrator is framework-agnostic. It works with any testing tool including Jest, PyTest, Mocha, JUnit, Playwright, and Cypress.

faq.question: What coverage thresholds are enforced?
faq.answer: Default thresholds are 80% for unit tests, 100% for API integration tests, and all critical paths for E2E. These can be customized per component.

faq.question: How does it integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Test Orchestrator emits structured events for test completion, coverage, and quality status. CI systems can consume these to block or allow deployments.

faq.question: Is test data handled securely?
faq.answer: Test Orchestrator recommends using fixtures and mocks for sensitive data. Never use production credentials in tests. Isolate test environments from production.

faq.question: Tests are failing but code works. What now?
faq.answer: Check if tests are flaky, have race conditions, or depend on external services. Use retries for flaky tests and ensure proper mocking of dependencies.

faq.question: How does this differ from other test tools?
faq.answer: Test Orchestrator coordinates multiple test skills rather than executing tests itself. It provides strategy, planning, and quality gates across all test types and frameworks.
